description.narrative: To counter real and present threats to the rice heritage, small rice producers and rice consumers of Asia, PAN AP initiated the Save Our Rice Campaign in Asia in 2003. Since rice has such important political, social, cultural and economic significance to Asians, there was a need to develop a common strategy for a regional campaign and the Rice Advisory Council comprising representatives from most Asian countries was formed. The Council developed the Five Pillars of Rice Wisdom which capture the essence of Asia's rice heritage - Rice Culture, Community Wisdom, Biodiversity-Based Ecological Agriculture, Safe Food and Food Sovereignty. Guided by these pillars, the Campaign has planned and conducted activities to save Asia's rich rice culture and confront the threats to destroy it. While the goals and objectives of the Rice Campaign have been adapted and expanded over the last six years, it has consistently upheld the Five Pillars
